2.verse: Dear friend, I pray that you may enjoy good health and that all may go well with you, even as your soul is getting along well.

3.verse: It gave me great joy when some believers ( B ) came and testified about your faithfulness to the truth, telling how you continue to walk in it. ( C )

4.verse: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children ( D ) are walking in the truth. ( E )

5.verse: Dear friend, you are faithful in what you are doing for the brothers and sisters,  ( F ) even though they are strangers to you. ( G )

6.verse: They have told the church about your love. Please send them on their way ( H ) in a manner that honors ( I ) God.

7.verse: It was for the sake of the Name ( J ) that they went out, receiving no help from the pagans. ( K )

8.verse: We ought therefore to show hospitality to such people so that we may work together for the truth.

9.verse: I wrote to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves to be first, will not welcome us.

10.verse: So when I come, ( L ) I will call attention to what he is doing, spreading malicious nonsense about us. Not satisfied with that, he even refuses to welcome other believers. ( M ) He also stops those who want to do so and puts them out of the church. ( N )

11.verse: Dear friend, do not imitate what is evil but what is good. ( O ) Anyone who does what is good is from God. ( P ) Anyone who does what is evil has not seen God. ( Q )

12.verse: Demetrius is well spoken of by everyone ( R ) â€”and even by the truth itself. We also speak well of him, and you know that our testimony is true. ( S )

13.verse: I have much to write you, but I do not want to do so with pen and ink.

14.verse: I hope to see you soon, and we will talk face to face. ( T )

15.verse: Peace to you. ( U ) The friends here send their greetings. Greet the friends there by name. ( V )
